instructions: Provide solutions in the form "P(n, r)" or "n choose r" (e.g. P(8, 3) or 8 choose 3).
question: A class of 30 students elects four students to serve on a student leadership council. The teacher tallies the votes and only reveals the names of the four students who received the most votes. How many different outcomes are there from the election process?
explanation:
Answer

30 choose 4
The students only learn the names of the four students who are elected. Each student that is elected plays the same role as the others. Therefore, the outcome is just a subset of four students chosen from the class of 30 students.
